1.brief: elevation, i.e. the act (literally, a journey to a higher place, figuratively, a thought arising), or (concretely) the condition (literally, a step or grademark, figuratively, a superiority of station); specifically a climactic progression (in certain Psalms)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, to bind firmly, i.e. (by implication) to be (causatively to make) plump; also (through the figurative sense of dumbness) to dream

2.brief: at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)
at that time or place; also as a conjunction, therefore
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

4.brief: to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
exile, concretely, prisoners; figuratively, a former state of prosperity
properly, containing, i.e. a tube; also a bed or valley of astream; also a strong thing or a hero
the south (from its drought); specifically, the Negeb or southern district of Judah, occasionally, Egypt (as south to Palestine)

5.brief: to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)
to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)

6.brief: to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
seed; figuratively, fruit, plant, sowing-time, posterity
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
